snippet: Commissioner William J. Bratton will tell the City Council how he plans to retrain all 35,000 officers to help prevent deaths after a suspect died on Staten Island.
abstract: New York City Council will question Police Commissioner William J Bratton over his plans to retrain New York’s police force in response to the death of Eric Garner after his arrest on Staten Island; hearing is essentially a fact-finding exercise but it will also provide an opportunity for the Council to flex its muscle on police practices and policies.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner William J. Bratton will tell the City Council how he plans to retrain all 35,000 officers to help prevent deaths after a suspect died on Staten Island.

headline.main: Council Members, at Hearing, Will Question Bratton About Police Retraining After Chokehold Case
headline.print_headline: Council Members, at Hearing, Will Question Bratton About Police Retraining
